algorithms.RSSalg

Class MajorityVote

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Algorithm
      • algorithms.RSSalg.MajorityVote

  • public class MajorityVote
extends Algorithm
    The prediction for each instance is acquired by aggregating the votes of the trained classifiers

    The aggregation method is specified by the algorithm implementing the VoterIF. For example, when applying to multiple co-trained classifiers with different splits and using MajorityVoter, this is the MV experiment from the paper J. Slivka, A. Kovacevic, Z. Konjovic: "Combining Co-Training with Ensemble Learning for Application on Single-View Natural Language Datasets". Acta Polytechnica Hungarica 10 (2))).

    Relies on reading the created statistics about testing each of the classifiers. It is mandatory to set the ClassifiersFilename parameter in ExperimentSettings to the location of statistic file

    The confidence of the resulting classifier is calculated as entropy: for each label confidence = sum(-probability_i*Math.log(probability_i)), where probability_i is the confidence of the ith classifier for the given label

      • run

        public ClassificationResult run(CoTrainingData data,
                       int fold,
                       int splitNo,
                       boolean recordClassifiers)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: Algorithm
        Run the algorithm
        Overrides:
        run in class Algorithm
        Parameters:
        data - separated labeled, unlabeled and test data
        fold - current fold of the n-fold-cross validation
        splitNo - the current feature split run for the fold (e.g. in RSSalg for each fold, m feature splits are created for co-training)
        recordClassifiers - whether to record statistics about building and testing each of the classifiers (see Algorithm.getClassifiers() and Algorithm.getClassifiersTestData())
        Returns:
        Classification result. The performance of the algorithm is evaluated on the test set defined in CoTrainingData object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - loading statistics about test data failed - check whether the specified file exists
